author: A D Balasubramaniyan
text:
AIADMK functionary Vijay whose wife has applied for a party ticket to contest from Vandavasi constituency in the coming assembly election was abducted by unidentified persons. They allegedly threatened him for aspiring for the ticket and released him after inflicting a minor injury on his face.

Vijay, a native of Chennavaram village near Vandavasi, runs a school in Venkundram near Vandavasi. His wife Annapoorani, AIADMK panchayat secretary of Chennavaram, recently applied for a party ticket in Vandavasi.

Vijay and Annapoorani’s sister Anitha (22) were proceeding in a car from Vandavasi to Chennavaram on Sunday night. When the car was about to turn into the village from the Vandavasi-Melmaruvathur road the abductors allegedly attacked the car and smashed the wind screens. Vijay, who was driving, lost control and the car rammed into a wall. Vijay and Anitha were forcibly taken in the abductors’ car for 20 km. The two were later released.

According to Vijay there were eight members in the gang that abducted them and the abductors mistook Anitha for Annapoorani and threatened her to not to aspire for party ticket. One of them injured him in his face and then left the two near Ramapuram village on the same road. They were treated at Vandavasi Government Hospital.
title: AIADMK functionary warned against aspiring for ticket
